subtitleNullable: A 400 days sad journey to baldness, from a postgraduate student.
descriptionNullable:
### As a postgraduate student and a future data analyst, the hair loss issues haunted me all the time, since I was 20 years old. 

#### My hair loss measure methodology
The way that I used to measure hair loss is that you put your one hand on your forehead, then move your hand towards the back of your head, make sure that your fingers is seperated and travel through your hairs. After this, count how many hairs that fell on your hand. Under 3(Low) means normal hair fall-off, a 4-6(Medium) means you have a slight hair loss symptom, if it's 6-10(Many) means you are experiencing hair losses, and over 10(A lot) indicates that you could have serious hair loss symptoms.

#### Scientifical test method: Pull Test and Tug Test
This simple test measures the severity of hair loss. During a pull test, a dermatologist grasps small sections of hair, about 40 strands, from different parts of the scalp and gently tugs. If six or more strands fall out, you have what’s known as active hair loss. (Cited from https://nyulangone.org/conditions/hair-loss/diagnosis) 

###There are 14 data items: 
* date (PK)
* hair_loss
* stay_up_late
* libido (This was used to subjectively measure hormone level)
* hair_grease
* pressure_level
* coffee_consumed
* brain_'work'_duration
* school_assessment 
* stress_level
* shampoo_brand
* swimming (This one was picked because I thought that a long time soaking in poor quality water could cause hair fall out)
* hair_washing
* dandruff
title: Luke Hair Loss Dataset
